Package slogo.compiler

Class Compiler

java.lang.Object
slogo.compiler.Compiler
public class Compiler
extends java.lang.Object
Parses user input to check if it is valid Slogo syntax. If so, orders instance of Function to execute corresponding Command implementations.

  • Method Details

    • isInputValidSyntax

      private boolean isInputValidSyntax​(java.lang.String input)
      Checks if user input is correct Slogo syntax.
      Parameters:
      input - user-inputted commands
      Returns:
      true if input follows syntax rules.

    • getCorrectedInput

      private java.lang.String getCorrectedInput​(java.lang.String input)
      Finds incorrect Slogo syntax in input string and replaces first mistake caught with special character to signify error. If input is correct syntax, original input String is returned.
      Parameters:
      input - user input
      Returns:
      string with first error marked. If input has no errors, original input returned.

    • splitInputIntoCommands

      private java.lang.String[] splitInputIntoCommands​(java.lang.String input)
      Splits input by token into a string array. Should be called on input conforming to valid Slogo syntax. However, method checks input in implementation once more and returns string array of length 0 if input is invalid.
      Parameters:
      input - user input
      Returns:
      String array containing commands and parameters. If user input is invalid, string array of length 0 is returned.
